titles.title: A bill to convey to the town of Frannie, Wyoming, certain land withdrawn by the Commissioner of Reclamation.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici under authority of the order of the Senate of 3-17-2005 without amendment. With written report No. 109-46.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 65.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power.
Mrs. Drake moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 101.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/1/2006--Public Law. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to convey by quitclaim deed, without consideration and subject to valid existing rights, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to a specified parcel of land to the town of Frannie, Wyoming. Reserves any oil and gas rights for the United States. Revokes a special use permit and two Secretarial Orders issued by the Commissioner of Reclamation with respect to the land.
